title: **A) CVS Treatment:**
body: CVS are treated with nitric acid o/n, briefly washed with H<sub>2</sub>O \(5x + 4x 30 min) and spread separately on Whatmann paper to dry. Dry CVS are baked in the oven \(165 <sup>o</sup>C; o/n)

body.body: Place CVS into 24-well plates \(sterile)
Coat CVS with 400μl/well poly-D-lysine in Borate-Buffer \(1mg/ml; sterile filtered) for > 5 hrs into the incubator.
wash CVS 3x with H<sub>2</sub>O and let them dry in the hood
coat with 5μg/ml laminin in PBS for > 2 hrs into the incubator \(400μl/well)
wash 3x with PBS, replace it with NB medium \(400μl/well) and put it into the incubator

title: **C) Isolation of Hippocampal Neurons \(adapted from Jenny Lauterbach - ref 1):**

body.body: put 4ml of SM and 4ml of NB medium each in a dish to pre-warm it in the incubator
pre-warm trypsin at 37 <sup>o</sup>C in the water bath
take E18-19 embryos from rat, cut off the heads and collect them in a dish with chilled dissection medium \(DM)
carefully open the skull, remove the brains and transfer them into a new dish with chilled DM
separate the 2 cortices from the rest of the brain, remove their meninges and cut out each hippocampus; collect hippocampi in a 15ml tube filled with 10ml DM on ice
remove DM, replace it with 1-2ml warmed trypsin and incubate 20 min at 37 <sup>o</sup>C in the water bath
flame Pasteur pipette to decrease the diameter of the tip, take off the trypsin and wash hippocampi 2x with 1ml warm SM
add 1.5ml SM and homogenize tissue with the fire-polished Pasteur pipette  by pipetting up and down 20-30x
centrifuge 5 min at 80g \(650rpm)
remove supernatant, resuspend neurons in 1-3ml pre-warmed NB medium using the fire-polished Pasteur pipette
count cells, and plate them at designated cell density \(e.g. high density 25,000 cells/cm<sup>2</sup> ) on prepared CVS

title: **D) Calcium Phosphate Transfection \(general protocol)**
body:
Mix for 4 wells \(24-well plate): 


900μl fresh NB medium 


100μl Transfection Mix containing: \(37.5 μl H<sub>2</sub>O – DNA \(4-7μg) + 12.5 μl 1M CaCl<sub>2</sub> + 50 μl BBS)

body.body: mix H<sub>2</sub>O with CaCl<sub>2</sub>
add DNA, mix by slowly pipetting
add BBS to DNA-H<sub>2</sub>O-CaCl<sub>2</sub>-mix
mix with 900 μl warm NB medium by vortexing
take away the old medium from the cells and quickly apply 250μl of the transfection-medium mix to each of the 4 wells.
incubate for 1.5-2.5 hrs
warm up HBSS for washing
wash cells with pre-warmed HBSS until most of the precipitate is removed
add 300 μl of NB medium per well to the cells
stimulate 2 days later

cluster EphB- Fc, ephrinb-Fc or Fc one hour prior stimulation at RT: Mix EphB/ephrin 4 μg/ml + 1/20 anti-hFc \(0.2 μg/ml) 
  e.g.: 300μl medium/well: take 6 μl EphB2/ephrinB2 + 0.325 μl anti-hFc \(1/10)
stimulate the cells with clustered EphB2, ephrinB2 or Fc by adding the appropriate amount \(4μg/ml) into the wells for 8 hrs in the incubator
put cells on ice to stop reaction
remove the medium and fix the cells by adding 200 μl/well 4% PFA \(4% sucrose) for 12 min on ice
wash 2x with cold PBS
remove PBS and add 200μl/well cold NH4Cl for 10 min on ice
wash 2x with cold PBS
wash 1x with RT PBS for 5 min
wash with H<sub>2</sub>O
drop of H<sub>2</sub>O and mount CVS using Gel/Mount anti-fading medium \(Biomeda) onto a glass slide
Take pictures using an epifluorescence microscope
Analyze changes in spine length and spine head size using MetaMorph software
